Breakfast is good, but for the 4 of us would of been 80 Euro's ( not sure if a discount applys to the kids )and given that the children eat little first thing in the morning , the cost would of been high . Breakfast was included in the price , so not a problem, but personaly if we go back and breakfast wasn't included we would eat out in one of the many Cafe's nearby. Overall a very enjoyable stay and enhanced by the Hotel Le Littre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gewitter
Reviews.Content: Good room, good location, good neighborhood, good staff

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Very tense departure”
Reviews.Author: Richarfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel le Littre from June 30 to July 5. The room was larger than some Paris hotel rooms, but not large by American standards. A good sized bathroom that was up to date was provided. Internet service was free in the lobby only, so several of us hovered over our ipads or laptops in the lobby. The hotel is very quiet, especially for Paris. We ate breakfast in our room, getting coffee in McDonald's and pastries and yogurt in a nearby cafe. The staff was very helpful and nice. My one complaint occurred at the end of our stay. We ordered a car to take us to Gare de Lyon for a train that left at 11:16 a.m. On the advice of the staff, we ordered the car for 10:15 a.m. Without our knowledge, the reservation was changed to 10:30 a.m. and the driver was late, arriving at 10:45. 30 minutes to make our train in Paris traffic was not enough time. We made it only with one minute to spare, and then only by running up stairs with heavy bags (the escalator was broken). I would suggest asking for an earlier pickup time than you need to be sure that your ride gets you to the train on time. Aside from the near heart failure of the departure, we had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rivergirl1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good deal for the3-4 star hotels in Paris as far as size and facility go. We had the standard room #610 which was located opposite the main street. It was quiet compared to the incredible street noise known in Paris. Even though it was right beside the elevator, we were never bothered by hallway noise etc. PROS: Close walk to Metro, cafe's and great shopping. Prices were cheaper in this area and increased as you got closer to the busier more popular intersections. We walked to the Latin Quarter and the Seine River almost daily, but the 1.70 Euro it costs to take the metro is worth it if you don't want all the walking. The room itself was clean, bathroom looked renovated within the year, with lots of hot water and excellent water pressure. Toiletries were provided and replenished daily, as was the towels. The room was very large compared to European standards, with open Juliette windows , small tv, mini bar, bath robes, safe etc. We used the mini bar to keep our cheese and snacks in. The day staff were very pleasant and helpful but the night staff were not as friendly. I have to give them credit, this was a surprise trip from my husband, and the hotel left cookies, a tote bag and a bottle of Evian in our room as a gift for our anniversary. That was a lovely surprise! CONS: The mattresses. When you are paying to stay in a hotel, you're really paying for a clean, comfortable place to sleep. The mattresses were old and we kept waking up with our arms numb. Not the best scenario when on holidays. I hope this is their next step in renovations because I'd love to go back once they change the beds. Internet: It costs 5.00 Euro a day to use the internet. A little steep we thought. There is an internet cafe across the street for about 1.50 Euro's. The hotel has two computers only and if someone else is on, you could have a very long wait. OTHER INFO: When traveling from the airport, forget about booking a shuttle through the hotel, its so expensive. We found Paris Shuttle on line and went for it. You call a toll free number from the terminal-while waiting for luggage- and it only cost us 18 Euro per person for one way. When we came out to find him, he was already there! When we tried to book our return trip to the airport (CDG), they were booked up. I'd definitely go with them again. I've also used Grey Shuttle, but they're more expensive, but also reliable. There is a breakfast at the hotel for 20 Euros per person. We never went because we loved walking to the surrounding cafe's. You can find eggs and whatever for around 4.00/6.00 Euro's in most cafe's. Totally worth the fun adventuring. The big cafe's are sometimes more pricey, but you can find coffee for 3.00 Euro's on one side of the street and it will be 6.00 Euro's directly across the street! BTW the coffee is out of this world! Evenings: go buy a bottle of wine, some cheese etc and take your picnic to the Seine in the evenings. People sit down all along the river and freely eat and drink and watch the sun go down. This was one of the most memorable and fun things we did as a couple. Belgium is only a 1 hour 20 min ride on the Thalys train. We found some good deals on the internet and spent a day in Brussels. We enjoyed Belgium waffles, amazing shopping and chocolates. Cost us about 130 Euro's return fare. Totally worth it! Ladies: try checking out the French lingerie stores! The prices are at least 35-45% less then the brand name, luxury items in the west. Also, the shoe shopping is great because all the shoes are leather and the prices were reasonable. Try Bocage for designer shoes at 100 Euros or less! Sunday Mornings: Organic outdoor market about 5 min walk!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel with helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Salsa44
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a small side street it is near to 3 Metro stations, bus stops & other good transport links - & also quiet as no noisy traffic nearby! There are also many shops, cafes & restaurants nearby & the Luxembourg Gardens are about a 15 minute walk away. These gardens are very nice with plenty going on, especially on a Sunday morning. Breakfast was served in a very nice room, there was a good choice of food & the waiting staff were efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff .”
Reviews.Author: Jjudung
Reviews.Content: There are many restaurants, metro and bus routes that go through there, making it a wonderful area to stay in. The staff all speak english and go out of their way to be of assistance. The room was lovely and large. My only recommendation would be to request an inside room, if the noise of traffic will disturb you. Though we didn't experience the trip that we had planned, the Hotel Le Littre made our trip the best is could be. When we return to Paris, we will certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrigleynj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two children ages 8 & 6. We had two rooms which were connected. The rooms were a great size and the bathrooms were huge and modern (nice pillows). The decor is a bit dated but it was clean and adequate for a weekend stay. The staff was wonderful. They were quite helpful with suggestions and directions and spoke English. On our first night, they called a cab for us, which took much longer to arrive than quoted. The driver had already started the meter from when it left its last stop. The staff noticed this, argued and resolved it with the driver as we got into the cab. We were really appreciative of this since we hadn't noticed the meter already running and the driver didn't speak English. The buffet breakfast was good and had nice variety. The service at breakfast was fabulous and attentive- a nice way to begin the day. The location is good in relation to cafe's and brasseries and public transportation. A bit of a walk to heart of St. Germain but close to Jardin du Luxemberg which is a fabulous park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, pleasant staff, but room needed updating”
Reviews.Author: mizdarcy
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the hotel got off to a rocky start as I had booked a family room for 2 adults and 2 teenage kids, however Hotels.com made an error and the reservations showed as only being booked for 2 adults. (we all missed the error on the Hotels.com confirmation and consequently had no proof of the request. Note to self...check all reservation confirmations carefully). Although it was not the hotel's error they were kind enough to give us a break on the cost but still the additional charge was $500 US dollars for 5 days. The room #208 was very large with a very large bathroom and double sink with the toilet being in a separate area. The room was very clean, however it needed some updating..the bedspreads were old and faded with some stains and the carpet looked as if it could use a good cleaning. Otherwise the sheets and towels were fresh every day and the lobby area was quite clean and attractive. Although the hotel is on a small side street off of Rue de Rennes it was not quiet. Our room was over the hotel entrance and we were awakens every morning by garbage trucks, delivery trucks and hotel guests rolling suitcases out the front entrance. (We asked to change rooms but were told that all of the family rooms were on the front of the hotel in 108 and 208). We did try to sleep in several mornings but were awakened by someone drilling into the walls above us at 8 am. We complained and they stopped, resuming at 10 am. The location of the hotel could not have been better! We were right around the corner from the Montparnasse/Bienvenue Metro stop and were able to take a # 95 (catch it in front of McDonalds) city bus across the street directly to the Louve. There are lots of restaurants and bakeries very nearby. We ate most every morning at Brioche Doree, a chain servings coffee, croissants, quiche, sandwiches etc. Quite good! The staff was very helpful in giving us directions and were very pleasant, even though we encountered some "issues. I would definitely stay here again and am recommending it to friends who will be traveling to Paris soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, clean & safe. Many thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: RomyPup
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay there and would return without question. I will recommend this hotel to friends and family. It is located near many cafes which was convenient at night. It is near the metro and they sell packets of metro tickets which are a good deal. The staff also patiently explains how to get around on the Metro. They have the museum pass available at the same price as on-line. There is a private driver available for to and from the airport which is a better deal than a taxi. For those of you who enjoy a large American cup of coffee, there is a Starbucks nearby. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Medstrike
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and it was my wife's first time in Paris. We found LeLittre to be perfect: good location in Montparnasse, close to the Metro, busses and cafes. The room was comfortable, the breakfast excellent and the bar a cozy spot to end each day. But the best was the friendliness and courtesy of the staff and the impeccable service from the front desk to the waitstaff at breakfast to the bartenders. One morning when i went to get coffee and juice to take back to the room, a waiter not only brought it to me, he insisted on placing on a tray, adding a copy of the International Herald Tribune, then carrying the tray up to the door of our room. We will be back to Paris and we will return to Le Littre.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to return”
Reviews.Author: alina_birsan
Reviews.Content: I must confess that we return to Littre each 2-3 months with my family as we are seeing an oncology clinic in Paris and we are very happy with this hotel, especially in what regards my mother's comfort. It is very well placed, clean and comfortable, not especially in this order, but we definitely like to stay here. I did recommend this hotel to several friends but due to high prices they preferred a different option. My suggestion towards their management was to create a frequent customer program and they did contact me, unfortunately without a clear and advantageous offer towards us, but I still hope that they will find this idea useful. I find the breakfast price a bit exaggerated, 20 euros/person, and offending that they don't provide free wireless internet connection and they charge Ethernet connection with 15 euros per 24 hours, as the price per room is high anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: arw521
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris to visit our son who is studying there. Upon our arrival, our son got sick and was unable to act as our tour guide. The hotel staff became our personal concierge. They found us a doctor who came to the hotel and made sure that my husband and I understood the metro and bus systems. With their help, we were able to navigate Paris quite well. The Montparnasse section, which is where the hotel is located, is a busy area. There are many restaurants, shops, metro and bus routes that go through there, making it a wonderful area to stay in. From Montparnasse, you can access any part of Paris. The staff all speak english and go out of their way to be of assistance. The room was lovely and large. My only recommendation would be to request an inside room, if the noise of traffic will disturb you. Though we didn't experience the trip that we had planned, the Hotel Le Littre made our trip the best is could be. When we return to Paris, we will certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: joesChicago
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel on a unpretentious street in the Left Bank. It exceeded our expectations in all regards. Rooms were quite nice, good service, food and bar and free internet in lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Smiff58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated for a holiday in Paris. Although it is very central, it is tucked away from the busy roads and is very quiet at night. It is spotless, the rooms comfortable, light and charming. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were superb, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little gem”
Reviews.Author: taylor4_10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Paris - 1st visit, and couldn't be happier with this hotel - staff was very helpful, room was wonderful, lovely breakfast and within walking and bus stop distance to everything. Extremely quiet for sleeping. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, plus the price was extremely good for such a generous size room and bath. B. Morgan, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel without frills”
Reviews.Author: delboy99
Reviews.Content: We wanted a 4* hotel close to the centre of Paris & choose this due to the good reviews it had. The location was fine just 3 mins walk from the metro & close to various restaurants & shops. The hotel itself was down a small side road so nice & quiet .. it was clean & the room we had was a decent size .. bed was comfortable with good sized bath/shower room, it had a television & mini bar Breakfast was buffet style, hot & cold with plenty of choice. The hotel itself needed a bit of updating, especially on the staircase & landings which were a bit drab & in need of a makeover.. Bar area was adequate but we never used it as there were plenty of bars close by with more going on. we paid £500 fo 4 nights which was expensive for what it was but Paris appears to be an expensive place to stay if you are looking for a 4* hotel .. although the Littre would not be a 4* in the UK more a 3* Yes, i would stay again but would be reluctant to pay as much as i did this time. Staff we encountered were helpful & friendly. Be prepared to pay more in Paris for things than back in the UK, This is obviously due to the currant exchange rate .. Even having a coffee in Starbucks costs you over £3.00 ... In the evening look for restaurants that do a set price for 2/3 courses, it will save you money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CandJNorwich
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel when searching for somewhere to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. Had stayed in the area before and knew it had good transport connections as well as a good selection of places to eat. Reviews looked good and the hotel lived up to expectations. The walls were a bit thin but overall it was very comfortable and roomy (including the bathroom) with a very good selection at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A gem with paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lella7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what the hotel called a "Junior Suite". It was lovely with a huge marble bathroom, a bedroom and a sitting room with a pull-out sofa. the only problem was the noise from the other rooms. A phone rang in one of the other rooms and it was so clear i answered the phone in our room! I could hear hammering, showering and singing from the adjoining building. While all of this was tiresome, we would strongly consider staying there again. The staff was top rate. Exceedingly polite and helpful. The location is very convenient to the Montparnasse section and the Rue de Rennes with restaurants, shops and exchange money bureaus.

Reviews.Title: “what a delight”
Reviews.Author: easingup
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and research we chose to stay at Le Littre Hotel in Montparnasse area for 4 nights. This was the end of our Europe holiday and we wanted a nice room with a view of the Eifell tower and to be close to restaurants and activity. So glad we did. It is a great hotel. Stayed in room 709. Bathroom was spotless, it looked very new. Good size bath tub with flat bottom, (easy to shower in). Bed linen crisp and luxurious. Our room had a large balcony with table and chairs and had good views over the area and of the Eifell Tower. It is a side street so were not bothered by noise. There was a fruit shop, bakery, small pub/bar, mini supermarket, and a couple of cafes all within a few metres. Just around the corner loads of cafes and restaurants. Very convienient and lots of choices. The breakfast was buffet style and was included in our room rate, mainly continental but satisfying. Staff were great, friendly and spoke good english. Helped us with choosing a few tours and organized transfer to airport. Free wireless internet in the lobby and also a computers available for internet use in their internet room if you do not have your own. As with most of Paris, parking was a issue in the area, we took up their parking option for 1 night until we returned our hire car the next day. You do not need a car in this area...just a few metres from main road with metro and buslines. It took us months of checking and researching before settling on this hotel. My husband has a mobility issue so we wanted somewhere close to activity, transport, cafes and bars. This Hotel is great ...upmarket casual....and the location excellent. Worked out really well. Hope to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: rosside1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ideally located for our first visit to Paris. Montpernasse station short walk Room was basic but exceptionally clean. Clean linen provided every day, and room cleaned to high standard. Staff were courteous anfd helpful. Good choice for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and comfy”
Reviews.Author: harepus
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our 4 week honeymoon for 2 nights. I had done my homework and read the reviews here on Tripadvisor, and found out that there is one Deluxe room with a terrace. which we booked. (To get a terrace on Hotel Littre, you have to book a suite) This room was great value for money in Paris!! Very romantic and a very private huge terrace with panoramic view to the Eiffel tower. The decor of the room is on the romantic side, if you are looking for more modern, minimalistic, Hotel Littre is not the place for you. The location is central to shopping and metro, but you it's a long walk to the most famous attractions. The service at the hotel was nice except that they did not have bottle of wine to bring to our room! Alle the wine shops in the area was closed this sunday, and all we had was a small bottle in the minibar. This should be no problem in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, nice view”
Reviews.Author: mcvm
Reviews.Content: Worth for rooms with balcony and view for the tower, ex. room 804. Good size, very clean. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a romantic honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: AlainLemay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite for 8 days on the 8th floor. The room (804) was enormous by Paris standards, with a large bed, entrance lobby with wardrobe and an electronic safe, and a luxurious bathroom with marble like interiors and separate toilet for added privacy. The air conditioning worked very well (we actually had to turn it down a bit) and was quiet. The bed was good (not too hard, not too soft) and the street at night very quiet so we had no problem sleeping whatsoever. The best part though was the large balcony a table and chairs and a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. This is where we ended each day with a bottle of wine, watching the tower light up and sparkle. Breakfast was buffet style with lots of choices, French (baguette, croissants, chocolatines) or American (eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, cereals) style. It was included with our package but I believe it is 20 Euros otherwise. Generally, the staff were very courteous and very helpful. The hotel is situated on a quiet street but close (5 minute walk) to a major metro station (Montparnasse-Bienvenue) which means you can go anywhere in Paris in a cinch. There are also plenty of restaurants, stores (Galeries Lafayette), marketplaces (Au Bon Marché is nearby if you want to do some “épicerie” Paris style), etc. Another plus is that it is a 10-15 minute walk from the Jardins du Luxembourg, a great place to stop and snack on a baguette sandwich for lunch while you watch the children play with sailboats in the basin. This trip was for our honeymoon and we could not have had a better experience. We will definitely go back on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ursulahx
Reviews.Content: Located down an unpromising-looking side street, the Littré is actually a marvellous place. I stayed there with our partner and two small children, because it was recommended as child-friendly. OK, you won't get creches or children's play activities (although the hotel can arrange baby-sitting for you) but we found it perfect for our needs. The room (508) was enormous, one of the biggest I've ever stayed in. The air-conditioning was working perfectly (hooray!) and was quiet (hooray again!). There was no cot in the room for the baby, but one was brought immediately upon request (a proper wooden one, as well) and there was still tons of space in the room. My 5-year-old was delighted to have a huge sofa bed all to himself, and our bed was very big too. The decor could use a little sprucing up, yes, but I don't judge a room just on its style. The main thing is that it was clean and so was the excellent bathroom. Only one criticism: the shower had a small head and an inadequate screen. The boys were delighted that they could have a bath, but I could have done with more shower space. The multilingual staff were extremely helpful (one concierge insisted on speaking to me in English even while I was talking to him in French!). The breakfast staff varied from charming to aloof (but I think the aloof ones were just shy), and the buffet was almost as good as a Scandinavian hotel (and that's high praise). Yes, it's expensive but get there early and fill up for the morning. The street is mostly quiet (the bin collection is daily before 7am, and it will wake you - so it's a good job breakfast starts at seven!). The metro is literally around the corner (the metro station is Montparnasse-Bienvenue - the exit nearest the hotel is exit 8 (Rennes) - if you can't find it, head for exit 5 and follow the signs). Rue du Cherche Midi on one side is good for bistros, and rue de Rennes on the other side is great for shopping. Some of the other rooms might be small (going by the reviews here) but ours was fabulous. I can't see why you wouldn't stay here unless you absolutely must have free wi-fi. Presque parfait!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: uphnguyen
Reviews.Content: We just spent one week in Paris, staying at this nice hotel. We are extremely satisfied with the courteous and helpful staff, the cleanliness and the overall ambiance of the hotel. Location is good, it is on a small street but close to the metro, boutiques and cafes. Will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. We only wish that Internet would be free in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: drdave91
Reviews.Content: Paris is an expensive city to visit and this hotel was a good trade-off. The hotel is located around the block from the Montparnasse metro station, a hub where several different lines converge making it possible to easily get anywhere in the city. It is also close enough to the city center that for those who like to walk, you are mere minutes by foot from some of the city's great sights and attractions. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are spacious, clean and reasonably comfortable. Our rooms had queen sized beds and pullout love seats and we had no problem settling in to sleep after long days seeing the sights. The hotel's included breakfast is a great value and the staff is pleasant and helpful. And there are a number of boulangeries and brasseries within short walking distance (1-2 blocks) for nearby lunch/dinner fare. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok 4 stars hostel”
Reviews.Author: mcpp
Reviews.Content: I found the breakfast GREAT and the service was very good and friendly but the rooms were bad, old beds and too noisy! but spacious bathrooms therefore i wouldnt recommend,cos there are better hotels for this price!

Reviews.Title: “Le Littre charming, good location, and excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: CloisterGarth
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides charming and cozy accomodation in a good location close to nice shops, transit stops, and a metro station. The room was a generous size and very clean, and had three large closets so we could store our luggage. The washroom was large and clean as well. The breakfast was very nice --- cereals, breads and pastries, and hot dishes. We were very impressed by the staff --- they were knowledgeable, extremely helpful, and very friendly. They went out of their way to provide us with directions around the city as well as sharing some "insider tips" about the city, including good places to shop and eat. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and all-in-all it was worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal and good quality”
Reviews.Author: EMa68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different hotels of the Montparnasse district quite often and this is the best deal so far. We were 4 including 2 children (9 and 12) and the mini-suite was ideal. Very roomy even when the sofa was converted into a queen bed for the kids, nice up to date and clean interiors, well insulated from other rooms. The air conditioning worked very well and was silent, a rarity in France. Big clean bathroom with lots of light and marble like interiors. Separate toilet same style. Lots of dressers to keep your clothes. The personnel was polite and welcoming. We did not try breakfast. If I have to find a drawback I'd say that while the room windows are double paned, you will still be bothered by the garbage collection for a few minutes in the morning at ~6am. We all loved the place so I would definitely come back especially because getting a nice place at an affordable price is not an easy task in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, average..”
Reviews.Author: jaimiebissell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't exactly fabulous. We picked this hotel because it was the cheapest in the area, so we can't really complain too much. The beds weren't very comfortable, and the pillows were flat.. But honestly, after a long day of walking around Paris, I couldn't care less. WATCH OUT FOR THE BREAKFAST BUFFET. It appears complimentary, because you literally just walk up and sit down. Someone eventually casually walks by and asks for your room number, and the next thing you know, 20EUROS per guest gets added to your bill. There's no notice, no warning, no sign.. The breakfast WAS good, though. But just be AWARE that you're paying for it. Considering breakfast AKA petit dejeuner is about 8EUROS for a coffee, orange juice and a measly croissant at nearby bistros, I suppose paying 20EUROS for all you can eat is worth it. They had a spread with bacon, eggs, fruit, cereal, cheeses, meats.. All good things. The location was GREAT. Montparnasse metro can be confusing, so just make sure you exit the right way. DEFINITELY get a Navigo pass. SO useful. The Littre bakery next door is AMAZING. We showed up a few minutes before closing to pick up crossaints, and when we got back to the hotel we noticed that they tossed in TONS of extra goodies, including chocolatines. Mmmm! Also the Brioche Doree right at the corner has these killer Mango Lemon Granitas.. I consumed many. What else, what else.. The internet situation was definitely NOT ideal. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby (or as they say, le wiffy), which is decent. You can sit on the sofa or chairs and plan your next day in Paris. The internet available to the rooms is 20EUROS per day and you have to give them 50EUROS for a cable.. Don't bother trying to mooch Wi-Fi from surrounding networks, I tried the entire trip. If you didn't bring a laptop, don't even bother. The computers available to guests are ancient, they are DELLs, and they are ridiculously slow. Also, Europeans have a different keyboard layout, which makes it difficult to use. The TV is small, but you didn't (hopefully) come to Paris to watch TV, so who cares? There's only a handful of french channels, which I found surprising, and one english channel which was CNN. Overall, it's a decent hotel. The staff was friendly, but sometimes a little snooty. They always answered our questions politely, though. Like I said, we chose it because it was the cheapest. If I had to do it over again, I might choose a hotel that included free Wi-Fi, because I felt like such an American sitting on the sofa in the lobby checking my Facebook.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Le Ittre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donelaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Le Littre for 8 nights. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the location. We were very close to the train station and to the underground. We could catch the Hop On-Hop Off bus right around the corner. We didn't care for the breakfast selection or its high price though price. It was convenient so we tried it one day. You can even arrange to be picked up for certain Gray Line tours, right at the Le Littre. We had a standard king size room, but it was huge. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: DDtravelTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and attentive. The triple room was sufficient but not luxrious. The pillows and mattress were hard and minimal but the bathroom was well appointed with robes and a decent blow dryer. I thought the location was a bit difficult to access. The hotel is two blocks from the Metro but difficult to locate with the Montparnasse Metro station having multiple exits. Overall, we had a good experience but would not consider this a four star hotel even for Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: meredithAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at Hotel Littre. While the Internet photos are a little deceiving, the room (standard triple) was perfectly large and comfortable enough for the 3 of us. The bathroom is as large as those found in good American hotels. The location is great - on a quiet street just far enough from the bustle of the city, easy to get around, easy access to metro, easy access to pastries, fruit and shopping and good cafes. Lots of ATMs, even a post office on the corner. The staff was very helpful and the hotel is immaculately clean. I agree with the review about the hall lights...sometimes it was very dark and the motion sensors are a little slow..but this was really the only thing 'wrong' with this hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: freckles131
Reviews.Content: Not sure how hotel got 4 star rating(?) Hotel bed was so hard and very uncomfortable! The hotel claims they have internet service in rooms but no cable for the connection and asked us to go and purchace a cable in the area! The hall lights are all on dimmers so when you get off elevators you step into darkeness until the motion picks you up. The hotel claims to have a good location but still had to get into cabs or find the metro which was a nightmare to get off due to the 5-6 arms that feed off exit in metro.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: TGYL
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews I wondered if I was at the same hotel. Room is small and ordinary - best thing is the renovated bathrooms. Hotel front desk was not all that friendly nor helpful. Not what I expected from a 4 star boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: asaw_nyc
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights. the staff at the front desk is very helpful. the location is very good. Metro is very close and the cab to most attractions is reasonably priced. Also it has shopping options close by ( we broke one of our bags and were able to buy a cheap one at the galleries Lafayette) and very cute boutique stores. room and the bathroom were small though but i guess thats the norm in Paris. Also they had free WiFi in the lobby. we were able to call everyone using our Iphone and Skype

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: englishroselondon34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break in Paris immediately after our wedding. The location in Montparnasse is excellent - very well connected but not too touristy. There are many excellent restaurants and brasseries nearby, particularly a superb seafood restaurant called Le Criee on Blvd. Montparnasse. The hotel was immaculately clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The free Wifi in the hotel lobby was a nice touch! We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, finding that many cafes nearby served excellent breakfasts. Only one minor gripe: the air conditioning system in our room was a little weak. No problem at all during a mild May, but possibly a concern in the height of summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, if right price then just book it”
Reviews.Author: Fazzaitken
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris 3 times before. If I go back I would stay here again. Hotel is in perfect location to explore (because it is near an interchange) and close to lots of bars and restaurants. Hotel itself was great. Our room was larger than I had expected, extremely clean and comfortable. We did experience some noise and can only think we were below a laundry room. Breakfast was great, good selection even to the 10.30 deadline. All staff were very helpful and pleasant and if I had to say negative comments I'd say minibar was tres cher (but isn't it always) and fact that don't have tea/coffee facilities in room was a bit of a disappointment. However, overall, if you can get a decent rate on this hotel then it is worth it (I paid £414 for 3 nights for 2 people with bf included). Other tips for Paris would be buy Versaille tickets in advance, use metro and RER as so easy and cheap and wear comfy shoes. It's a fab place, I'll definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: travelladyLondon
Reviews.Content: Terrific Hotel. Clean private & public rooms. Clean sheets and towels everyday, Fantastic breakfast. Great location. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderfull hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Luframaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed for more than 7 days at this perfect hotel and we did have a very good time, wunderfull rooms, services and accomodation. Nice Hotel at a good location ,near to metro stations and nice restaurants. Really nice place to stay in the luxures rooms

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebwrite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Littre for four nights this past week. We had gotten a good deal on Hotwire, but I was concerned about the location being too far from central Paris. It turned out that it was a great location with the Metro close by. We had a junior suite on the 8th floor and the most wonderful large marble bathroom. We had a terrace looking out to Sacre Couer. It was a nice, comfortable room. The staff was very nice and very accomodating. In terms of food, we never at at the Hotel but there was a great bistro at the corner and we loved 1900 Montparnasse which was our absolute favorite restaurant in Paris. In short, it is a very nice, unexceptional hotel and we would certainly not hesitate to go back. Our only objection was 9.50 EU daily charge for in room internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Gets my vote”
Reviews.Author: sean-tKerryIreland
Reviews.Content: Having selected this hotel because of it's high ranking on Tripadvisor it's easy to see why this hotel is in the top 100. Check in was very speedy,courteous and efficent.Well furbished hotel in a great location in Paris. Nothing wrong with the rooms. Breakfast is fine with plenty variety. Yes you could do worse!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: ELLABLEUE
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay in paris on 4/15/09. I stayed a the littre. It was awesome. The staff at the hotel was wonderful. One of the boys Gregory made recommendations about a couple of clubs such as barrio latino that was great. Breakfast in the mornig was good but redundant. Of course, knowing europe the room was small, the bed comfortable, efficient room service. Location was great. It was located in Montparnasse close to Eiffel tower and Louvre museum. Paris is EXPENSive. LOve paris!!! but dislike the people in the streets of paris, they are very rude, they pushed you , step on your toes. OVERALL GO to the LE LITRE OF RHENNES IN Montparnasse. ELLABLEUE

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: princesspentium
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on April 4th for our wedding anniversary. PROS - Were upgraded to a room on 7th floor with double doors out onto a balcony which had great views of the Eiffel Tower. Balcony also had 2 large pot plants and large table & chairs. Room was newly decorated, very clean, Mini bar, queen size double bed, flat screen tv, with BBC World News, CNN & Sky News. Lovely bathroom with bath & shower, nice bath products and 2 towelling robes.Buffet breakfast was included in our room rate of 179 euros, excellent choice of juices,cereals, fresh & dried fruit & nuts, yogurts, cheeses & cold meats, assorted french bread, croissants & pastries, jams etc & tea & coffee. Hot buffet of bacon, sausages & scrambled or boiled eggs also on offer. Very good position (5 mins walk) near Bienvenue Monparnasse metro Line 4. Lots of cafes/restaurants in area within walking distance, very buzzy and 'French'. Le Montparnassee 1900 is lovely example of Art Nouveau decoration - we ate there on Sat Night. Bistro de Breteuil - fantastic value 38Euro menu for lunch/dinner with 3 courses, aperitif, wine & coffee. Both bookable through www.toptable.co.uk CONS - Not many - bedside lights were ineffective, when wanting to read in bed. Room was very airless and aircon controls were a bit of a mystery - couldn't get cool air blowing so had to leave balcony doors ajar to get some air in. Overall - enjoyed our stay, staff were cheerful & helpful & would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Friendly, Cheerful Service”
Reviews.Author: Entre_Amis
Reviews.Content: I especially liked Sabrina from Morocco (if my memory is correct) at the front desk. We upgraded to Rive Gauche Suite No. 801 which had a long hallway, kitchen and huge master bathroom with separate toilet. The master (bedroom) was huge by Paris standards and came with very large walk-in closet. The living room had desk and sofa which doubled as a queen bed. Location was 0.2 km to Tour Montparnasse & Metro. Boulangerie a few steps across Rue de Littré. Try le flan coco. Don't pass go, just skip to Le Littré and collect your $200 in pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “**** Excellent from Canadian Eyes'!!!!! ****”
Reviews.Author: Funbehad
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Paris I was skeptical of this hotel. Numerous ratings I read suggested this hotel had many issues which could taint our visit. While I realize reviews can be tainted based on a negative experience, I am happy to report our stay with the Littre was A+. Allow me to expand.... Pro's: - Wakeup calls 3/3 - Great cleanliness of room - Large bathrooms - Comfortable Queen Bed (medium to firm) - Flatscreen TV with several English News Channels (for the rainy days) - Helpfulness of the staff (contacting and setting up: Tours, Paris Shuttle Service, answering Q&A's) - Location of the Hotel is a bonus (McDonalds at end of block, Metro close, Lafayette Mall, many restaurants close by, grocery markets) - Politeness of cleaning staff Cons: - Issue with Hot and Cold temps of shower early in morning. Check the temp of water first before stepping into shower. In wraps..... This hotel is close to everything. We walked to most attractions in 20-30min. The Metro was an added bonus for the 1-2 drizzling days we experienced, or for trips farther out. Misc Items unrelated to hotel.... Although the Eiffel tower level 3 (top) was closed for repairs, this attraction is amazing. It is also a stones throw from all other attractions. I highly suggest you take a good pair of walking shoes for the Louvre Museum. We spent 8hrs at a brisk pace and saw roughly 90% of the museum. BTW, skip the 6euro headsets unless you have loads of patience to operate the device and walk at a snails pace. Lastly, I highly recommend the D-Day Normandy trips to all those history buff's. The trip was splendid, great lunch, professional staff. This trip also allowed us to see a good portion of France's countryside in one day. Hope you have a wonderful trip ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Finally we find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Duran12RiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: We try to find a good hotel with good price in Paris since 4 years and finally we find the Le Littre Hotel. Very good hotel, with nice room and bathroom, excellent location and exceptional service. We will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Vuittongirl
Reviews.Content: It's all about the fantastic location. Right in the middle of where you want to be when your staying in Paris. Close to the huge Montparnasse Metro station. We had looked for something that didn't scream "American" and found it. We stayed four nights and got a great value. Travel agency was able to find a buy three, get one night free package with full breakfast that was truly outstanding. Room was big and clean, nonsmoking and quiet even though we were on the streetside. I had looked this place up on the internet and thought their website was very up to date. Place was child friendly, but saw lots of couples who looked like they were on honeymoon. Even though we had prepaid out trip we left a small tip for the breakfast servers and our room cleaner. They hustled and kept the place going in tip top shape. Would stay there on our next trip to Paris. No Worries!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice and the room size was quite reasonable by Parisian standards. Room seemed clean and had decent sized bathroom. Staff friendly and helpful. It was nice and quiet in the room but the location was central. We could walk to most sights and tourist attractions and it was close to Metro stations. There were lots of great places to eat very close by. We had the buffet breakfast and were pleased with this though there wasn't much selection of hot food. I would have liked it if there was a kettle in the room but that's nothing major. Pleasant stay, pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Whitney44
Reviews.Content: I spend six very nice days in this Hotel. The Staff was wonderful. From the people at the front desk(especially Michael), to the maids that serviced the room, to the attendants in the dinning room, We found everyone accomadating and very nice. Three of us stayed in a room that was spacious, clean and tastfully decorated. We had one king sized bed that split and a loveseat that pulled out into a bed that was comfortable. I was concerned about a cot being brought in but that was not the case. The pull out bed was just fine. The breakfast was plentyful. We had a nice selection of eggs, bacon, sausages(pork & veal),cereals, yogurts fruits, breads, cheeses, cold cut meats, pastry, juices, coffee and tea. There is plenty of shopping, cafes and resturants in the area and the Metro station is just around the corner. If you like to walk is is convenient to everthing. The section of town is not luxurious but a commericial area that has every accomadation and convenience one would want when taking a sightseeing trip. I would definately go back and reccomend it to other.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Piastre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Littre for Valentine's day weekend. I booked through the Hotel's website where I found the most favorable rate. The Hotel is nice, I wasn't dissapointed. Location is right next to Montparnasse Bienvenue station, my room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, so romantic. The room and the bathroom were spacious, the room had a plasma TV and the closet had enough room to fit my clothes (not easy to find in Paris). The staff was really friendly, helped with our reservations, but the guy that works in the breakfast area is simply the best. So nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: poppy033
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay in Littre Hotel. Location was outstanding, very easy to walk nearly everywhere but also very handy to a few different metro stations. The street was relatively quiet but very close to some very busy streets and lots of restaurants and shopping. There is also a wide range of cinemas nearby, with many showing original version movies (in English). Room was very large by Paris standards and the bathroom even had a bath, not just a shower. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was satisfactory. Internet access in the foyer was very convenient. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyyhky
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about; the room was very clean and well equipped. I could even see the Eiffel Tower from my room's balcony. The downside of having an own balcony was getting also some street noise through the door, though. In overall, the room was good, the location was good, the breakfast was good and the hotel staff were good. So the hotel can easily be recommended for anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: nonbusinesstraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful week at the hotel litre in april. With so many hotels to choose from in Paris in was a difficult choice, but we could not have made a better one. The trip was my birthday present and the staff upgraded our room to a lovely suite, spacious with a beautiful pink marble bath. The staff were they friendliest we have met anywhere, helping with resevations directions and suggestions, they were a big part of making my trip to paris a dream come true. So if like us you are having trouble choosing a hotel in Paris look no farther this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: DHogg
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a short stay in Paris. Its location is ideal to hop onto the metro, find nearby cafes and restaurants, and to get to/from the airports. We experienced the friendly and attentive service on several occasions, from the welcome to help with booking tables etc. Our room was excellent, bathroom spacious and hot water galore. Be sure to find some of the special offers via various travel websites and agents. We got 3 nights for 2 without trying too hard. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: afds
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Le Littre last month and really enjoyed our stay. We booked a triple room through the hotel website, which offered a better rate than the agencies I usually use. I'm not sure if we actually had the triple room or were upgraded to a junior suite, anyway it was perfect, with plenty of wardrobe space and a huge bathroom. We didn't have breakfast there because there are lots of places nearby, but the dining room looked very attractive. The staff were always helpful and welcoming, and I really appreciated the prompt email responses to my requests for information or help booking restaurants before we arrived. Unlike a previous reviewer I think the area is terrific. It's not overly touristy like the 1st arrondissement, but has plenty of activity, shops, restaurants, gardens, you name it. I wouldn't have chosen this area for my first visit where I wanted to be near the Louvre so that I could visit often, but I liked it so much that I think we'll keep coming back here. To stay at the Littre, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Littre”
Reviews.Author: bailyhowth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through weekin.net (a very helpful website) for the school mid term break. Myself, husband and 16 year old daughter stayed in 1 room (were upgraded to an amazing room on 1st floor -`108) which was very spacious and clean etc.. facing street which we did not find too noisy. Totally enjoyed our stay in this hotel and will return and will also recommend it to our friends. Staff were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfactory, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: yaneh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the cheapest room with a friend for 3 nights. The lobby of the hotel is quite lovely, but it goes downhill from there. Although the location is near the Montparnasse train station, it is far from most places if you want to walk. While this may be fine in the summer, when it is cold and rainy, it is not so pleasant, and thus you have to either come home before the Metro closes at 12:45am or take an expensive taxi. There isn't much in the immediate vicinity to do, so you have to take the subway everywhere you go. I paid around $200/night, which is far below the rack rate, and I would hesitate to pay more, even though that is a good rate for Paris. The bathroom was fantastic, but the beds were quite hard and uncomfortable. I wished they had spent less money on designer notepads and more money on the mattresses. That said, the room was well-decorated and it never felt sad or cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: GustavoBR
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel with my wife for 7 days in september. The staff is very kind and always wanting to help with everything (cabs, transfers, bags, etc). The breakfast is very good and above average for a parisian hotel. The locations is also great with two metrostations nearby and a lot of buses that you can use to the main atractions. On my next trip to Paris I will for sure stay there again. Great Surprise !!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT.”
Reviews.Author: MRS.TRAVELS.OFTEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last 4 days of our two week tour of Europe. Out of all the hotels this one was the nicest. Although we did a small up grade. OUR ROOM # 112 this is on the out skirts of the latin quarter, is a more quiet area. IF YOU WANT BUSY- the area of the latin quarter across from Notre Dame off St Micheals blvd. there are alot of souviener shops and resturants all in that area -Had a big comfortable bed two closets , a safe , a mini bar, a sitting area separte from bedroom and bathroom, a full length mirror. BATHROOM- big ,good water pressure, robes . very clean. ALTHOUGH- there is no air conditioning after october 01, It was warm when we were there but luckily at night it cooled down, we had to sleep with the window open, it was at this time i wished i hade a higher floor. RECEPTION; very nice ,spoke english and gave you a great map. BREAKFEST; out of all 4 hotels, this had the best breakfest. eggs,bacon,salami,cheese,yougart,cereal,fruit,toast etc. Very close to all means of transportation. NOTE****TRY NOT TO TAKE THE TOURS ,GET AROUND ON YOUR OWN, that is when you see the best stuff, the METRO- IS VERY SAFE AND CHEAP>!!! walk until your legs scream at you THINGS I RECOMMEND::: Get a paris or and musuem pass- you BYPASS ALL LINES , you have already paid YOU GO RIGHT TO THE FRONT OF THE LINE.. go to " [-] " or paris pass/museum pass. we bought the 2 days PARIS COMBO PREMIUM PASS. @ .. .$ 59.00 each. that gave us unlimimited metro/rer pass for that 2 days (they worked for longer we used them for three) we got into so many places for free and no lines check it out it works and i loved it.. also included was a free Seine boat cruise we didnt use , i told the concerige of our hotel to give it to another canadian. the only thing not included in those passes was the eiffle tower. 1st floor is $7.00 to the top is $12.00. SEE it both in the day and at night. the tower sparkles for 5 minutes every hour on the hour, really pretty, and the little gift shop on quai branley to the right of the tower before going over the bridge has really good prices for souviners. check there before you buy anything from hte street guys ,so you don't kick your self for over paying. NOTE*** a really great place to eat is HIPPOPOTAMUS great food tips included in the price, go before 8:00pm or after 10:00 pm it was very busy- the chicken was sooooooooo good

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Located Perfectly”
Reviews.Author: JILLZONE1
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Littre this past July for 4 nights, and got free buffet breakfast with excellent service. Also, we stayed the 4th night for free. I beleive the district/arrondissements where the hotel is located is in the urban/trendy section. Being both 29 years young, this suited us perfectly. Concierge was great, extremely helpful at all times, even late at night! Go to spots were mapped out for us. Metro is easily accessible from Montaparnasse B. or Saint Placide. BTW...take the metro EVERYWHERE it is SO easy! We had a balcony room overlooking the avenue. It was amazing....recommending this hotel to everyone and we will return Littre indefinetly.

Reviews.Title: “great service, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zoeboey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short 2 night business trip, and this hotel made it a pleasure. The quality of the decoration was good and the rooms were well designed with a lovely spacious bathroom, a powerful hot shower and a good sized bath - which I needed to soak my feet in after a hard day pounding the pavements of Paris! My standard room was a little on the small side - but in Paris I think that is usual. Nice flat screen TV's left more room on the dressing table. There are several different types of room, some old fashioned some modern. Mine was a lovely new modern room, didn't see what the traditional one's are like. Not sure that all rooms do, but my standard room had a balcony with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The only thing I could pick fault with is that for a four star it had no spa, pool or gym so maybe that could put you off - but I was way to tired at the end of each day to think about that! I wouldn't normally stay in the Rive Gauche / Montparnasse area, I had though it was a bit too far from the main attractions. This is not so! Its very easy to get to the Louvre / Place de la Concorde etc without changing Metro lines, and you sure get a lot nicer hotel for your money in this area. Breakfast buffet was good; fruit, cheese, ham bread, croissants, pain au chocolat, etc as well scrambled eggs sausage and bacon. All in all my stay here was a pleasure - the staff deserve an extra mention as they were all pleasant and helpful anytime I requested any information or help.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very charming and comfortable . It was a great location for shopping and restaurants but a little far to the main attractions. It was hard to get a cab off the street but the hotel seemed to be the best bet to help out. The staff was very friendly and helpful and took the time to help you find your way. The rooms were very clean, especially the bathroom. The only complaint I have was that there were only 3 english channels on TV so when it was time to relax we had to either watch BBC or CNN and BBCPrime. Otherwise, breakfast was awesome and I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Le Littre shines”
Reviews.Author: TopCat17Durham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Littre hotel from the 9th to 13th September 2008. The immediate impression was a relaxed, charming hotel with wonderfully helpful and friendly staff, and a hotel that made me relaxed and feel at home. It is in a quiet street so little or no traffic noise. The breakfasts are very good. The room we had was spacious with private bathroom - and the bed was so comfortable. OK it is not the most modern, but I find Le Littre has more charm than a plastic 21st century hotel packed with facilities that I don't need or use. Our stay coincided with the fire in the Channel Tunnel - as we were due to return that way, the hotel staff were exceptionally helpful in advising us on various courses of action. Overall our stay was excellent and unquestionably I will return to this hotel in future when visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “HO hum”
Reviews.Author: jaymay
Reviews.Content: This hotel IS well located, but I can only suggest that travellers ask to see a room before they agree to a stay....this hotel bills itself as 4 star...but i notice it's three here...closer to the mark I think. Clean yes, but VERY small room , small double bed, and most rooms look out onto the "inner courtyard" which is another name for the windows of the other rooms that look out onto the courtyard, Quite noisy , slept with the windows shut and left the aircon on... Yes, friendly staff, but I did not see any rooms that look like those I have seen on the website....maybe the suites are better.... but if you are used to a four star hotel , the room we stayed in would not do it gor you Breakfast. well I can never understand why people pay 25 Euros for a continental breakfast in Paris when they can get great coffee, juice and pastry around the corner at a french bakery for 3.70...but then... Hotel is not value for money which can be found, say, through hotwire at the Hilton...and lacked the atmosphere to make up for the dollar difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine92
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with the Hotel. Great location. Friendly & helpful staff: front desk & restaurant. Comfortable beds. Large bathroom(walls/floor need spring cleaning!). Our room was on the 4th floor facing the yard so no street noise. Carpet or ventilation must have been clean because no allergies occured during the entire week. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: soccertraveller2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely met our needs for our four busy days and nights we were in Paris, but didn't feel like a charming Paris boutique hotel. It was a little worn and lacked charm. However, it was clean and the beds were comfortable. The front staff were great and the breakfast was fine. The street it was on, Rue de Littre, was not charming either and boy was it noisy. Our room was on the second floor and faced the street. Every night there were loud people up at the bar til late into the night. The noise really detracted from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Nurserosetta
Reviews.Content: The Littre is in an excellent location. The staff all speak English or give it their best to speak English well. They were great when I was trying to speak French. I hadn't spoken French since high school..30 years ago!! I got better as time went by! We were very central to everything. The public transportation is really really easy to travel in. The day we arrived we went to Mcdonalds at the end of the street and found a little market at the opposite end of the street and around the corner..take a right out of the hotel and right at the end of the stree...Le Marche is located at the next street. There is a larger one on Monteparnesse. It's one stop shopping..food, wine and toiletries at a reasonable price. The staff at the hotel are excellent. We were greeted by very helpful front desk staff. Upon our arrival they gave a map so we could map out our excursions the night before. They told us how to get our train tickets. They also told us about double decker tour bus. We decided to buy the 2 day pass. It was a great way to get the lay of the land. After that we were good to go on our own. The breakfasts were great. There is something for everyone!! No excuses for starving!! it definitely fueled us up for our day outings. I suggest bringing a good pair of walking shoes. We were exhausted everynight from our excursions. The bathroom is amazing. My husband loved the shower and I loved the deep bathtub. The water pressure is excellent. I was also happy that we had a fridge in our room. We bought water and wine everyday. It was wonderful having a chilled glass of wine upon our return to our room. If you want ice..you have to go down to the bar. The only problem we could find is the main elevator. It is very tight fit. We were luckily located on the rightside of the hotel..It is a little larger and it takes you directly to the dining room. The main elevator only takes you to the main floor and you have to walk down the stairs. We were able to print off our boarding passes before leaving the hotel. All and All Paris was amazing. Most everyone speaks english. They are happy when you try to speak French..even it's a mix of English and French. It is a fantastic place to visit!! We loved it..the only down point is that we had to go home!!! :( We found an amazing Italian restaurant on Monteparnesse call Les Comediens located @44, Boulevard Montparnasse, Paris. The food is excellent and prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: tqn
Reviews.Content: I find that this hotel is a great little hotel to stay in. The staff was very friendly to us. Every question I asked they were able to answer. I tried to speak French to the staff but my French was horrible. It is a good thing that the staff can speak decent English. I love the breakfast room and the breakfast buffet that they are serving everyday. Next to the hotel is a small meat and fruit market with great pate and jambon. If you would be willing to walk a little further down (10 minute walk) to where the Gallery Lafayette is there is a big shop like Walmart called Monoprix next to it where they everything that you need to buy at great prices. The hotel's location is also very great. I can take the Metro closely located by the hotel (5 minute walk) and can get to any places in Paris. It is also close to the L'Open tour hop-on, hop-off bus. The room was clean and comfortable to live in. Cleaning service was also great. I don't have many bad things to say about this hotel at all except perhaps I do wish that they would have an ice machine for the customer in the hotel but I couldn't find one. I would also wish that they provide free wireless internet service but they do not. It is available with cost. But with that said, I still like this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkjimmychoos
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a city break through the 'Euro Star' website and what a bargain it proved to be! The location is ideal in terms of access to the subway and walking in the local area, and the hotel itself was charming and very clean. The staff were very helpful too and the rooms were comfortable and spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a city break in Paris as it is great value, close to amenities and the continental breakfasts were great- particularly the croissants! Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull little hotel in Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: Bonjours
Reviews.Content: June, 2008 Reviewer: Season travelers, middle age couple from Canada We have just returned from a 10 day trip to Paris where we stayed at the Littre Rive Gauche in Montmartre. This hotel had been recommended by our airline and we booked through our agent. To our surprise the room was large (which is unusual in Europe and especially in Paris). It was very well appointed and immaculately clean. The location is within 1.5 block of several main metro lines and in a good district for shopping, eating or just walking around. The staff was very helpfull and breakfast was more than we expected again with very courteous and attentive staff. This was our 3rd trip to Paris and this was the best budget hotel we have stayed in. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sawbucks100
Reviews.Content: My family had the opportunity to make Le Littre Hotel our home away from home for almost two weeks. We were a party of 9 (booked three rooms) so getting accomidations/reservations for a party this size is not always an easy task. We were very pleasantly surprised with the size and cleanliness of the rooms. Two of our rooms ended up being like a mini suite in that the hall accessing the two adjoining rooms had its own door (showing both room numbers). We frequently used it in this fashion. Bathrooms were very large. The only plumbing problem we had was that the tub in one room would not hold the water in (solved this by using a cup over the drain). Fresh towels and toilettries were brought in everyday (although had to get used to using no washclothes...I guess thats usual in Europe). Air-conditioning was a godsend especially after a long day in the city. It made sleeping at night much more tolerable. Front desk staff I found very helpful. They all are fluent in English and I'm grateful for that fact. Francois and others tolerated my feeble attempt at French. Location of the Hotel is off a very busy intersection. Though because it is on a side street one didn't hear much noise from street traffic. Metro is very close by. Also located on Rue Littre are a Boulangrie (very tasty pastries), Meat market, fruit stand and post office. We didn't find out though until 3 days before we left that a mini market (Le Marche Franprix) was located around the corner on the same block. We had previously walked to the Monoprix market a quarter of a mile away for drinks nad groceries (and one has to transverse 5 crosswalks dodging traffic to get to it). Breakfast was a nice treat that we all looked forward to every morning. The staff were very friendly. Cavatti (sp?) and Louisa were always very attentive. The cafe au lait was eagerly anticipated each morning. Along with the tasty croissants and pain du chocolate. Although I agree it got a little mundane after a week of having the same items. I went to having Granola and yogurt the last two days. Quality was always very good though. Other items to be noted: Internet is available in the computer room for a small fee per each day of use (three computers). This was nice since no laptop was brought. Laundry service is pricey...so we brought detergent to wash 1-2 days worth of clothing in the tub/sink. There is a coin op Lavarie about a 10 minute walk away. 1e for 9 min dry time. Definitely would stay at this hotel again and would surely recommend it to anyone looking for a decent Hotel in a good area.

Reviews.Title: “What a ride!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Eh23
Reviews.Content: Just returned last week. First time ever in Europe. Selected this hotel based on reviews. Stayed 7 nights. Location was quite central and lots of restaurants nearby. Hotel personnel and service was excellent. Like another reviewer, I found the American buffet tiresome but was good quality with decent selection. The scramble eggs were unusual. Not sure if it was cooked the "Parisian" way. Way too much milk and a bit undercooked. The front desk was quite helpful in recommending local restaurants and transit to the major attractions. However, they did lack some knowledge when I inquired on where to buy the RER/Versailles combo pass that I read about in Rick Steve's travel book. The rooms were quite clean and odourless even though I was in a smoking room. However, sometimes I could smell smoke coming in through some of the vents. The only other complaint I had is the shower. It was very very slow to drain. I believe another reviewer mentioned this as well. The hotel is definitely not handicap/people with limited mobility friendly but then again neither is Paris. Overall I was quite pleased with the hotel. Being a first timer to Paris, I didn't realize the alarm clock is built into the TV. I regret not thanking the staff on my last day as the pickup service to the airport was early and I had to rush out. I just want to take this opportunity to thank all the staff. I had a great experience at your hotel and looking forward to going back in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable - We'd Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Dtheresa
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to be said about this little hotel. It is quiet and comfortable, the bathroom was big, clean and the plumbing fixtures were modern and worked very well. A big plus when spending the day walking around the splendours of Paris! Could the rooms use an update? Maybe, but they are pleasant enough. Though we didn't have a particularly negative experience with reception, it could have been better (acknowledgement of guests is a good thing). I wasn't sure if I would enjoy being so close to the Tour Montparnasse because of noise - but the hotel was peaceful ... like a fellow reviewer I am sensitive to noise and didn't hear a thing in our room. Breakfast was fine (fresh and tastey) and the staff there was very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ATAM_9998
Reviews.Content: Paris is very expensive and rooms are usually small from a canadian point of view. Taking these facts as granted, I would return to the Littré any time. They have many employees at the reception but two are clearly outstanding (François and Nicolas) and they are working often. Others are not always as helpful. The room is relatively large for Paris. The bathroom is nice, clean and everything works. The breakfast is good and they have eggs, sausages, a variety of cereals and, of course, croissants, chocolatines etc. Even though we were next to an elevator, we did not hear much noise. (I am very sensitive to the noise.) The only problem we had is that one day we arrived at our room, the lock was changed and, of course, it did not open. We went to the reception and were given a new card as if it was normal to lock customers out without warning. The hotel is 2 minutes away from the metro Montparnasse which allows to connect to a few different lines (a strong plus if you do not want to spend a fortune in taxis).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: tonetone
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Paris on may 7th and stood at le Littre hotel for a week with 2 of my girlfriends. This is a great hotel located right off a major street where there are a lot of boutiques and cafes. very convenient. the metro is located about on block away. The Rooms where very clean and the maid came every day to refresh everything. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. my favorite was Nicolas. he is a funny man. I even gave him a bottle of run when we left. We need more men like Nicolas in the USA! the women at the front desk was very nice also. I forgot her name but she was young. Sorry : ( The breakfast at the hotel is worth it if its included in your packaged however if you like Varity I would suggest you go out for breakfast everyday because you get the same thing to eat everyday. the croissants are great!. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. I give it a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, old place”
Reviews.Author: ibpauliegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 stars, but the accomdations were not. The room, although a nice size, was very worn out, colors dull and worn out, bedding horrible, bed uncomfortable, bathroom fixtures made awful sounds (sink difficult to turn on and off), the tub is hard to get in and out, especially for older individuals.. The lighting is dismal in the hotel, and although the restaurant appears large enough, there is no "life" in the place. P & P in VA

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoBo24601
Reviews.Content: Duration of stay Sunday, 4/6 – Thursday, 4/10. Why we chose this location? We wanted a centralized location so we could walk to the sites and after looking at a ton of hotels, this one looked the best and one where we could get a decent deal with through our travel agent. Hotel is down a very quaint street and we always felt safe walking around no matter what time of day it was. Check-in was very painless and the people behind the front desk were ALWAYS nice and very helpful!! We apparently got upgraded for some reason, but who was I to argue. We took the lift to our room, 510. I believe it was 510 it was right off of the elevator to the left. I was worried being so close to the elevator, but this hotel was always so quiet. Very decent size to our room and the bathroom was also very decent. Both the room and bathroom were clean. The view from our room was a courtyard – it just overlooked the other windows of the other rooms of the hotel. We figured that the ceiling of the dining area was what we saw when we looked down on the ground. It wasn’t the most scenic of views, but we were out of the room during most of the daylight hours so it never truly bothered us. Safe & fridge worked. The thermostat in our room didn’t work though. We never thought to call, not exactly sure why, we just didn’t. We opened our window to air out the room when we were in the room and even slept with the window opened a bit as it would have gotten too warm. The outside temperature never really got that warm so I guess with the chill in the air and the warm air flowing, it was just fine. Breakfast was served each morning and it was part of our package. It was, OK. I more or less stuck to cereal or croissants with some jelly or cheese. The prepared eggs were a bit too runny for me so I opted for cheese to sustain me. There were also bread selections, yogurt, breakfast meats (sausage & bacon), juices, coffee, etc. The staff always greeted you with a smile and were quick to bring you coffee. I don’t know if I would pay again for the breakfast, but it was a good clutch to have to grab something quick on your way out the door. Location – for us it was a very decent location. It was about ½ hour walk in one direction for the Louvre and Notre Dame and then about 30-40 minutes in the other direction for the Eiffel Tower. Plenty of restaurants right up the block and up and down the street. Thankfully the hotel was down a small side street as the main street right nearby could have been an issue with the noise. But like I said, this hotel was always very quiet, we didn’t have one issue. The hotel bar was always empty and the front desk clerk would come in to serve you if you wanted something from the bar. The pictures that were hung up were of what the hotel was like “back in the day”, that was so cool. I cannot comment on the metro since we chose to walk everywhere. We did have one small issue - we left the “Do Not Disturb” sign on our door. It was our last full day so my husband and I figured that we wouldn’t bother with them making our bed, changing our towels, etc. When we returned later on that day we walked in to find that our room was in fact cleaned. I mentioned it to the girl at the desk and she said that she was doing housekeeping that day and called our room and since there was no answer she thought we left the sign on the door in error and came in to clean. Thankfully we didn’t leave out anything of value or of importance, but to me if I put the do not disturb sign up I would want them to stay out of my room. Live and learn and maybe tell the front desk to let the staff know to not clean the room. In the end it wasn’t a big deal, she apologized, and we moved on. On our last day we inquired about a taxi for our trip to the airport. They suggested a car service they work with so we opted for that thinking it was more reliable than some random taxi. We left plenty of time to get us to the airport and thank goodness since our car was about ½ hour late. Overall, this hotel was really great. Everyone we encountered was friendly, gave perfect directions, get advice, etc. I’d recommend this place if you are looking for a centralized hotel and for a quiet night and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tanto spazio/Lot of space”
Reviews.Author: rugg
Reviews.Content: Reception very friendly, room Saint Germain is very large, barthroom especially, above all respect the Paris standard. great breakfest. Internet fare on the hotel web site big deals!

Reviews.Title: “The second time in this hotel! Will come back again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bistomtom
Reviews.Content: My brother and I spent 3 nights here on the end of Feb 2008. This was my second time in this hotel in 2 years. The staff was still friendly and very helpful, and the quality of the room was the same as the first time visited. We lived in the room 309- was on the same floor but opposite to the room lived 2 years ago. The view was better this time but the size of the room was a little bit smaller. They got more computers(only 1 before) and a new printer at public area this time, and it was helpful that we dont need to wait for it. However, the bad news was now they charge for internet! Will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Treasure”
Reviews.Author: madmalteaser
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be taken to Paris for Valentine's Week by my boyfriend. He booked the hotel as part of a package with Eurostar and I have to say I was very pleased! The hotel was incredibly easy to find, just one Metro ride from Gare du Nord which was good as we had our luggage with us, and when we surfaced in Montparnasse it only took a minute to get our bearings and work out where the hotel was. It was down the pretty quiet street Rue Littre which had a large post office on the corner and a couple of little eateries on the way down to the hotel.
