I think there was also a school at the end of the road although I can't be sure. The reception to the hotel is gorgeous and we were given an extremely warm welcome by the reception staff who checked us in quickly and also offered us a map of the city along with some brochures. We were on the 6th floor so were very pleased for a lift. Our room was lovely, a decent size, clean and very comfortable. When we unpacked we discovered a problem with the safe in that it didn't work properly but after speaking to reception we headed out for the afternoon and by the time we came back it was either fixed or replaced! While we were there my boyfriend was taken unwell so we ended up spending an entire afternoon in the hotel. I ordered some room service in the evening as I was starving but my boyfriend was not well enough to go out - the food wasn't too bad, I had a curry and he attempted some soup with little success. The bread was lovely although I was so disappointed that we weren't provided with milk for our tea and coffee. It seems in France you have to ask for milk if you want it! We also had problems with our television in that the 3 English speaking channels all froze and never seemed to come back - obviously I wasn't too bothered on the days where we were doing something but when we had to spend the afternoon in the hotel I would have liked to have something other than my book (which I finished that afternoon!). All in all, this hotel is a lovely little gem. I would have no problems staying here again and would certainly recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Friendly, Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: TulsaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, but it would have felt differently had I not asked for an upgrade to a larger room that faced the small side street. I booked a deal through an hotel packager based in London (via the Internet) where I paid for three nights and received the fourth night free. I knew that I would get the most basic room. I had read other reviews that said that the hotel offered an upgrade if one was available. Most likely since I was getting a free night anyway, they were less willing to do that. Once I saw the basic room, I called the front desk right away to see if an upgrade was available. They offered me one for 50 additional euros a night, which I gladly paid when I saw the difference in rooms. The standard room was on the fifth floor and faced a bleak courtyard. My upgraded room was on the third floor. (I could walk upstairs to it and didn't have to use the small elevator.) The room had an entryway with a walk-in closet containing a safe to one side and on the opposite side of the entryway was a bathroom with just the toilet. Then you walk through French doors into the main living area which had a couch that folded into a bed, cocktail table, end tables, desk, bed, TV and two windows facing the street. The marble bathroom, (sink, tub) window, complete with bathrobes, was off of that. I thought this was quite a deal, because my four-for-three deal came with the 20 euro breakfast. The breakfast at the hotel is big -- about everything you could want. If you stay here, please greet the breakfast wait staff with a "bon jour." They appreciate just a simple acknowledgement. I saw people come down to the breakfast room, ignore the staff and just start filling up their plates. The location of the hotel is great. The bus just at the corner will take you right to the Louvre's front door. St. Sulpice Church is only a couple of bus stops away. Really, if you get a transportation pass while you are in Paris you can go anywhere. I bought mine right away and never had to worry about coming up with money when I took a subway or a bus. This hotel is also right on a couple of major subways. It's very easy to get around. I liked the bus best. (TIP: If you attend a concert at the Musee d' Orsay, you can exit right into the museum without waiting in line or paying an extra fee.) The front desk people were very, very friendly. As mentioned, greetings are important. If you don't want to learn any French, just learn how to say "Do you speak English?" The French appreciate your acknowledgement that you are in a country where English is not the first language. That courtesy will get you far and make people feel good at the same time. The shops up and down the main street by the hotel have good prices, and Bon Marche is pretty close by, though I found it very expensive. If you want to stock up on things for your room (like wine and chocolate) turn right and then right again when you exit the hotel's front door and you will find a small grocery store down a couple of blocks. I would recommend this hotel highly for being friendly, clean, pleasant, safe (I was there by myself), a good value and in a great location. Probably the only thing that I didn't like was the hand-held shower device (which is pretty standard in Europe) and the hair dryer. The latter looks and acts like an attachment to a cannister vacuum cleaner! Vive le difference! When I come back to Paris, I will stay in the Marais district next time. It has so much character, you think you are on a movie set. However, Hotel Littre is in Montparnasse, the stomping grounds of the Lost Generation, and it was fun to explore this area of Paris. Eat at Le Timbre close by. It is a Zagat-rated, open kitchen with only about 30 places to sit. The chef is from England but the food is French and superb.

Reviews.Title: “An Occasional Aroma Issue”
Reviews.Author: bddoughty
Reviews.Content: Littre 2/15 to 2/20 I liked this hotel and found the earlier reviews dead on with one distracting exception; there were periodic strong smells of sewer gas emitting from the bathroom, not the toilette chamber. I’m not making a joke or inviting others to joke, but simply wishing to pass along an experience so others won’t be surprised. I don’t know if this condition was limited to room 605 or simply one of those Parisian oddities. What I discovered was a small vent on the floor next to the bathtub, which if I kept covered, seemed to eliminate the problem. Since the problem was inconsistent, manageable and never existed in the room itself, I never complained; really didn’t want to repack in order to change rooms as I was tired after an already 10 day stay on the Right Bank. Nonetheless, a silly little experience. I did complain about all three English language stations being out, Friday 2/15 until 2/19 since I missed my daily political/news fix. I accepted the explanation that this matter rested with the provider, not the hotel. Internet available in Lobby for 5 Euro a day but they seem to be a little generous about this as it only appeared on my bill 2/6 days. Overall, I would certainly consider returning; however, if you haven’t been to Paris and don’t like to get about on the Metro, I would suggest something more central to the main sites on the Right Bank. A Big Tip: Allow plenty of time to get to CDG, at least two hours, three if you don’t want to be fretting about missing your flight while caught in traffic. I’ve never had problems until this trip, most times only an hour. Obviously I had been foolish, but lucky. Arranged transport through the hotel set fee of 59 Euro, Taxis about 50 Euro without traffic problems. If you’re going to take the RER better do some very detailed planning unless you’ve got a straight shot. Have a Wonderful Journey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: SanjB82
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our first trip to Paris as a valentines day surprise therefore i didnt get a chance to do much research on it. TIP - If you are travelling to Paris via a flight i would recommend using the metro as it is way cheaper than the taxi and only takes about an hour max. Taxi - approx 45 euros whereas Metro - 8 euros per person. On arrival we were welcomed with friendly receptionist staff. We were also given the option of choosing between 2 rooms - one on the 3rd floor and on the 7th. The one on the 7th floor had been recently refurbished and had a balacony you could sit on and look over to the Eiffel Tower but other than that the views were not the best. We then made our way down to the 3rd floor and although the rooms were not as modern they were more spacious. The new modern room was available but of course at a premium price of 60 euros per night. We werent going to spend a lot of time there so we decided to go for the one originally booked. The beds were comfy, the bathroom clean and there was plenty of space. The breakfast staff were very efficient and helpful but had the same buffet selection each morning. The staff were helpful when we were inquiring about some excursions. There was an open tour bus stop 5 minutes down the road which was helpful. For our trip to Disneyland we used the metro and there was a station just down the road too. Location wise you cant go too wrong - bus, metro, shops, food, cinema, bistros are all within walking distance However, we did have a few bad experiences - the cold tap in the bathroom made a funny noise when it was turned on and sounded as though the whole room was going to cave in. Also the one english channel they had was frozen so we were stuck watching the french channels. Other than that a nice find and a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Peter090
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay in some cheap and cheerful dive in St Germain, so the Littre was quite an upgrade for us. Best things about the hotel - the fabulous buffet breakfast and coffee - among the best you will find anywhere in Paris. Double room very quiet, comfortable, clean and stylish but view out, onto a nondescript courtyard was hardly romantic Paris...Yes, we could have changed room for a better view, but at extra cost. So we stayed put. Bathroom quite big, also immaculate. We drove to Paris and the Little does have parking, but around the corner, as part of the parking garage of another hotel. Parking is safe and secure - and 25 Euros a day - but not so convenient. Helpful staff, nice atmosphere, a little pricey perhaps, but worth it. The 64,000 Euro question - would you go back? Answer, yes, and we can't wait for more of the Littre's wonderful croissants and coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1983
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend break for my boyfriend and myself as a Christmas present, previously booking another Hotel and after reading the reviews cancelled my booking and we stayed at Le Littre instead after reading the good reviews. This Hotel is lovely and like the other reviews state down a nice quiet side street so not noisy like i would have expected from a Hotel in the centre of Paris. The reception staff all spoke very good English and were extremely helpful. We stayed on the 7th floor and i was nicely suprised by the room. It was a good size for Paris hotels and had a balcony with a view of the Eiffel tower. The bathroom was lovely and was brand new which was even nicer. There were white towelling dressing gowns aswell for guests which i thought was a nice added extra. The breakfast in the mornings was very nice with a great choice - bacon, eggs, sausage etc which my boyfriend tucked into but i couldnt resist the coissants and jam and fresh fruit salad. Cereal was available aswell with yoghurt and meat, cheese and bread etc. The Hotels hot chocolate in the morning was delicious (and very addictive!) The Hotel is in a good location, just far enough out of everything that it isnt packed but in good walking distance to all the sites. We didnt use the Metro or RER often and chose to walk to all the sites, we estimated we had walked approximately 10-15 miles per day but it was lovely just strolling around and taking it all in. On the times we did use the underground systems we had no problems at all and found this very cheap. The Hotel was happy to recommend restaurants and tours and we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay in Paris. We will definately use this Hotel again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: melhuntly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had never visited Paris before and found the location of the Littre to be in a fantastic area. Close enough to all the main sites of Paris but far enough away to not be completely in the hub of it. There were a couple of problems - I cut my lip on a chipped glass at reception and was not even offered a proper apology or even a free cup of coffee. Additonally the hauir dryer in the room didn't work. The staff were very pleasant though and the rooms of a decent size. Overall a decent not too expensive hotel in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay - The reviews are for real!”
Reviews.Author: MNTRVLRMpls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas 2007 for four days. We will definitely stay again, and we are recommending to this hotel to friends & family. Rooms: Large by Paris standards, we asked for an upgrade to the St. Germaine room, and they did so for no charge, as they had vacancies over the holiday. Well laid out floor plan with dual closets and sitting area. Bathroom was huge and extremely well appointed. Location: One block North of Montparnasse. Basically up the street and around the corner to the Metro entrance. Very convenient. Small tabac stop on same street sells Metro 10 pac tickets. VERY QUIET LOCATION, no noise at night despite being very close to Montparnasse. Staff: Extremely pleasant, they do try hard to please! They were very willing to help with anything we needed. Food: Breakfast was included in our package, it was just fine, and they did very well on the coffee. Breakfast meat, scrambled eggs, cheese, breads, fruit, yogurt, cereals, etc. They were happy to prepare a tray of coffee/tea/hot chocolate to take back up to the room. Room service options are limited, but they were very fast with the service and the food was fine. Cute bar connected to the lobby, was mostly empty during our stay and the staff would let us take a drink to our room or offer to deliver drinks to our room. A true value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We don't want you to know how GREAT the Littre is...”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMinded
Reviews.Content: ... because we don't want this wonderful little Paris secret to become too well known. My wife and I stayed here for 8 days in the fall of '07 and had NO complaints whatsoever. A solid four stars. The rooms are large, well-appointed. The bathrooms are huge with strong hot shower and big deep tub. We paid a small upgrade for the second-tier of room qualities (there are some sort of suites available on the top floor which are the best rooms on the property I believe)... I would recommend this for the extra space and the separate Living Room. The only thing you should be warned about are the pictures of terraces and Eiffel Tower views- both of these are only features of the top floor suites. Every other room, as far as we could see, would look out on the tiny narrow Rue Littre, or a garden courtyard behind the hotel. (Big deal, you're in Paris, even the alleys look better than at home) Perfect Location. A three minute walk past all kinds of shops and patisseries and breakfast grabbage places to one of the best Metro stations in the city... several lines available, and you should be able to get most places in the city with No or One Transfer between Metro Lines. Be Warned... the station is a maze and you could easily spend twenty minutes trekking to your line or trying to find the best exit to the street. Everything awesome about the 6th (your neighbourhood, as all hoods are numbered in an outward spiral from the city centre) is within walking distance of this hotel. Included Breakfast was substantial and perfect for fuelling up for a long day walking the city. Staff were helpful, if a little Euro-distant, making good recommendations for restaurants, handling airport limo confirmations, even sending my wife to the right place for a billion-dollar haircut (COST a million, LOOKED like a billion). The bartender in the hotel lounge (closed at midnight) was friendly and equally helpful. Maid service was thorough and conscientious. IF YOU DO NOT SPEAK ANY FRENCH make sure you begin your conversations with the staff (and all Parisians, really) by politely asking if they speak English and if they would mind speaking with you in this language. I've seen reviews decrying the staff for rudeness, but by our observations while we were there, it is highly possible that people brought some cold or abrupt treatment on themselves by assuming that everyone they met was ready or able to speak in (North) American English. France is a courtesy culture and if you don't have any courtesy to give out, you ought not to be surprised if you don't receive any back. Internet access is available for a small charge in the lobby. Be prepared to use a french keyboard that is ALMOST but just frustratingly not quite the same as a QWERTY keyboard. A perfect, perfectly romantic place to make your homebase as you visit Paris. We will stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny (euro)”
Reviews.Author: Hothellman
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived I was concerned about the quality because I have been in some terrible hotels in Paris despite good reviews. On arrival the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and this continued throughout our 3 night stay. The room was huge by Paris standards and the water constantly hot. Exceptionally clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good with the only complaint being the temperature of the tea and coffee (not hot enough). Location was also good - 100 meters from a metro station with 3 lines and easy links to everywhere. In addition the sightseeing bus stops 120 meters away. I am usually very fussy but this was up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Place”
Reviews.Author: FanofParis
Reviews.Content: Long overdue in writing this review. Stayed in the Littre in Aug 06 and Aug 07. Charming hotel, great location to Metro, Train, and Paris must sees. Rooms are clean. Service was excellent. Love the morning breakfast with fresh breads and apricot jams. Can't wait to go back. Can't say enough about the location and the ease of travel throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “Way Above Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Two_Wheels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond our expectations. Nicely located on the Left Bank and a short walk to two Metro lines, the staff was extraordinarily friendly (English speakers all) and helpful. Our room was incredible, large and with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The included breakfast was far above most continental breakfasts - it was a full breakfast including fresh OJ! My only complaint (and this goes for most Euro hotels) is that the smell of smoke comes thru the ventilation system slightly. This might be solved next year when France gets tougher on smoking laws, but if you are super-sensitive there can be a hint of that smell in your non-smoking room. I still give the hotel an Excellent rating since its pluses far outweigh the minor minus.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gerwen
Reviews.Content: Date: October 2 thru October 9, 2007 Reviewer: RJG Neither the travel agent or anyone I talked with knew about this quaint little hotel. We were very happy with the room and the staff. The breakfast was good with all the usual options. The room was comfortable with a lovely bath and large enough considering the amount of time you are in it. Hotel is close to all transportation that will get you anywhere you want to go. We walked a lot and found this location to be very close to all the major sights. Would recommend it and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: canadiangirl7
Reviews.Content: The Littre is pretty good value for Paris. The rooms are a good size by European standards. I found the bed really hard though - but, from all the walking during the day I was still able to sleep well! The area isn't the best in Paris but it is very convenient to the metro and the Montparnasse station is served by several lines so it is really easy to get around - you are never far from any of the sights. Breakfast is average - good if it is included but not worth the 20 Euros otherwise. The juicing machine for fresh squeezed OJ was a bonus. Overall a good hotel and I would stay again next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just be careful, very careful in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Blanche42
Reviews.Content: On my first morning I slipped on the bathroom floor and split my head open. It took 14 metal staples to close the wound. The hotel is in an excellent location and there is good shopping and restaurants nearby. The staff at the hotel are friendly, speak good English and were very helpful. The breakfast selection is good but the bacon is greasy. It would have been good to have coffee and tea making available in our room. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel just be careful in bathroom as it is all marble and has sharp corners.

Reviews.Title: “Super Little Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: BCP69
Reviews.Content: Super little hotel, all the staff were excellent,very polite and more than helpful. Room good size for the three of us , which included our 15 year old son. Near to some top notch places to eat. When you come to Paris stay here !!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddarlow
Reviews.Content: The Littré is tucked away down a side-street, not far from the Bvd Montparnasse, and it’s a treasure. The décor is smart and expensive; the reception staff are friendly and attentative, and speak fluent English. Bedrooms are (by Parisian standards) of reasonable size and well-equipped, with internet, room safe, mini bar, and two or three English language channels on the TV. Downstairs, an elegant subterranean dining room that offers an outstanding breakfast selection. It really is one of the best hotel finds I have made. The only slight downside is the location. Montparnasse was once the bohemian quarter in the early 20th century, but no more. The Boulevard Montparnasse now is a busy highway through a business and shopping area, dominated by the ugly Montparnasse Tower. (Parisians say the view from the top is better than from the Eiffel Tower – largely because then you don’t see the Montparnasse tower!) Still, there are plenty of good, small restaurants in the side streets near the hotel, including a charming family-run Chinese restaurant just further down the street. And for transportation you just can’t beat the Littré. Montparnasse metro station is very close, with links to absolutely everywhere, and it’s a short walk to the Latin Quarter, and many other attractions. I would unhesitatingly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: baark999
Reviews.Content: if you like shopping this hotel is well situated, right off rue de rennes, and close to bon marche. the rooms were standard paris small, but in decent shape. the 5 euro charge for internet use was a turn off, as well as them sneaking into your room to turn off the a/c so that instead of your room being cool when you got back it was really warm. for $200 bucks, with the euro value its about worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: I travel 50% of the time for my work, and take four or five personal trips every year. I am very confident in saying that this is the best tourist hotel in Europe. The rooms are large, clean, comfortable and very nicely decorated. The bathrooms have real bathtubs and real towels, thick and large. The staff is super. Every request was met with a smile and a very professional manner. Our first room was next to the elevator, which was a little noisy. They were more than happy to change our room, in fact, they upgraded us at no charge. There are several rooms that have balconies that overlook the Eiffel Tower. We were lucky enough to get one. Be sure to request one. The location is great. You are five to ten minutes, by Metro, from everything, right on the edge of the Latin Quarter and right below Sainte Germaine. There are also some great restaurants within a block. Check out Chez Souce, it's a small family place right on Montparnasse Blvd, very reasonable, great food and the wines were super. You can pay more in Paris, but there is no reason to do so. This place is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Room, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: uberleslie
Reviews.Content: The Littre was a wonderful little place to stay. We loved the staff and the location -- just around the corner from a central stop on the Metro and so close to great cafes and movie theaters. Our room was a bit tiny, which was disappointing. The bathroom was a nice size. Morning breakfast was tasty and had a good variety of choices...but I MUST recommend the Le Petie Littre Bakery just across the street. Amazing pasteries!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Definately Recommended!!! +++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Rixey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - down a quiet street, 2 minutes walk from lively nightlife. The hotel staff are really friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a very generous size, and extremely clean. All rooms come with complimentary toiletries, and mini-bar, which you obviously have to pay for, and as you would expect quite expensive! Breakfast is fantastic, with a wonderful wide choice of food. Bar a bit quiet as you would expect from a hotel bar, but staff always around to serve you whatever drinks they have on offer. Metro station is a 5 minute walk away with direct line to the main Gard Du Nord station. Bus stops 2 minutes round the corner. All in all a fantastic hotel and highly recommended. Very reasonable price for quality of hotel. The only one down side was the lift, which I guess from other reviews from other hotels is a common problem in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Littre, Montparnasse - very rude reservations clerk”
Reviews.Author: FlowerBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our experience got off to a very bad start as the reservations clerk / receptionist could not find our reservation and was very rude to us. She eventually found the reservation but did not apologize for her behaviour. We were very shocked and my son was quite upset by the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysUp4Travel
Reviews.Content: My mom and I had a very pleasant stay at the Littre' Hotel. The room was clean and definitely larger than expected, and the size and lay-out of the bathroom was especially nice. The continental breakfast in the morning was a great start to the day. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful with directions to explore the city. The hotel location is convenient: close to Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, Metro stations within a couple of blocks, great shopping on Rue de Rennes and at Montparnasse. The only negatives I can think of were that we didn't have a great view (just looked out at the building next door) and the TV only played 2 channels (which we didn't bother the hotel about, but possibly could have been easily fixed). All in all, it was a great stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in paris!”
Reviews.Author: BeckenhamBrian
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have visited annually for several years in May to this charming centrally appointed well kept secret. Quiet at night so you can sleep well after a great Parisian dinner at some of the best restaurants in Paris a few short minutes away. The staff are constant ...a great comfort. Rooms are spacious and well cleaned, fresh fluffy towels each day. A very good hot and cold breakfast buffet with attentive helpful and charming staff....English speaking! Email/Internet access for a small charge in the lobby...private! it deserves its 4* rating. Oh....and the shopping!!!!!!!!!!! We can't wait for next May 2008. Philip and Brian Beckenham Kent England.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: msopran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Littre during our honeymoon, and we both agreed that we would stay there again. At least one reviewer on here complained that she didn't think it deserved its 4-star rating, which suggests to me that she hasn't done much travelling to big cities. I have travelled to Paris, New York City, and Rome, and have found that the prices/quality of the rooms have been very similar. Our room at the Littre would be considered on the small side compared to someplace in the South or the Midwest, but compared to the places I've stayed in Rome and NYC for the same price range it was actually a little bigger. The buffet breakfast was good, but if it hadn't been included in the package our travel agent got, then I would have skipped it and gone for something at the nearby patisseries instead. One of the best things about this hotel was its location: it was just a couple of blocks from the Montparnasse-Bienvenue train station, which has connections to quite a few Metro lines, as well as a major hub for the regional rail system. The front desk staff was very busy, but very helpful. They gladly made reservations for the shows we wanted to see, and gave us information on getting to Versailles, among other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Approved”
Reviews.Author: PaulFoleyTravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the property - I was very comfortable during my stay, toured the hotel with the sales manager, and enjoyed both the bar and the breakfast buffet in the mornings with my colleagues. I would recommend to my clients as good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PurpleScout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Littre for a girls' weekend getaway to Paris. We booked the trip (air + hotel) through France Vacations and their rep recommended the hotel. We liked the price for a 4-star as well as the location and we were not disappointed. We had a spacious (for Paris) room with two twin beds, the configuration we requested. We also had a spacious bathroom with a full tub, pedestal sink and lighted mirrors, and of course the usual toilet and bidet. The room had a walk-in closet with wood paneling - - it was kind of dark in there and hard to see things, but lovely none the less. The location is great. It's an easy walk to Left Bank shopping, There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel is a great buffet with lots of choices. The hotel staff were very helpful. A few weeks before our trip, I emailed the hotel a page full of restaurant reservation requests and they took care of making all the reservations for me, then emailed me back to confirm. So much easier than contacting all the restaurants myself! One small disappointment: the bar was closed the entire duration of our trip. We peeked in the windows and it looked like exactly the kind of place we would have liked to rest with a drink in the late afternoon. A small flaw, though, in an otherwise very pleasant stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Hertshopeful
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of prior reviews. I can only give this hotel an average mark as it was disappointing. When I book 4* and pay for 4*, I expect 4*. What I got was a good 3*. If you can get a deal on the room rate, then this might be acceptable. The rooms were small but clean. The bathroom was large, clean and quite well equipped (no bathrobes as previously mentioned). The biggest problem was that despite turning off the radiator and turning up the air con, our room resembled a sauna. We slept under a sheet with the window open in February!! Also we had booked a double room (it was valentines week after all!) and we got two twin beds pushed together, but with their own bed linen. Thanks to a previous reviewer we knew about the great views from the Monparnasse Tower - which were as expected, spectacular. The area is akin to Leicester Square/Oxford Street in London, in that it is close to cinemas, restaurants that don't really mind if you don't go back and high street shops. There also seemed an amazing amount of American business people in the lounge area on their laptops at all times of the day. One day there was even a mini conference going on in an area no more than 12ft x 15ft. This lounge area is actually a euphemism - it was an area aside from the reception where you walked through to get to the bar in one direction and the lifts to the rooms in the other. Another example of the reason this hotel should not be classed as 4*. I could not really recommend this to a friend, unless they really had to be within a stone's throw of Monparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights from June 10th through June 13th. We booked the hotel through Expedia and received an upgrade upon our arrival. The staff were helpful and friendly. They gave us maps of Paris. The hotel is only a few minute walk from a Metro station. It's about an half an hour walk to the Latin Quarter, the Louvre, and other attraction. The room is large and clean. The bathroom is spotless. The weather was hot during our visit and the AC didn't feel like it was running sometimes. We didn't each breakfast at the hotel since we were not big breakfast eaters and it costs about 17 Euro. There are plenty of places around the corner where cheaper breakfast are available. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my sister and our niece in 1 room with 3 twin beds. The room was large and the beds didn't feel squeezed in. The bathroom was huge and very clean. Our room faced the inside and was very quiet. The staff were very helpful, spoke english and allowed us to store our luggage after we checked out as our flight wasn't until the evening. We found the location ideal for access to the metro and one day we walked up to Rodin Museum, which wasn't too far. There were lots of restaurants to choose from and we would recommend the Seafood Restaurant La Criee. My sister was also thrilled to find a starbucks there as well. I would definitely return one day.
